TopicTitle: [1.1.2] KSPRC - Renaissance Compilation: artworks remake [V-0.7 Pre Release 3]

Articles.Content:
Ah, there was an update yesterday. Testing...

EDIT: Looks like that fixed the map shots. Surface shots for Mun and Ike are still grey and hazy like that.

OK. I will try to rework that. Should be a subtle glow only barely visible in daytime, caused by the light reflection in the surface. But seems like the DOE black sky effect in surfaces reduces the effecto to a grey gradient... Should be fixed in the next update.

Proot: it does indeed! You know that big glow on the horizon that planets with atmospheres have? You can edit density, height, and color (two ways). There's an ingame editor (left ALT + G) and various stats you can add to the cfg.

https://github.com/NathanKell/RealSolarSystem/wiki/AtmosphereFromGround-RSS-Settings

That looks really interesting, but can that changes be used in the vanilla game or only in RSS?

Can confirm that this is a RC bug. Completely fresh install, and newest versions of everything.

Gonna try to reproduce it. Thanks.

Edited April 18, 2014 by Proot

OK. I will try to rework that. Should be a subtle glow only barely visible in daytime, caused by the light reflection in the surface. But seems like the DOE black sky effect in surfaces reduces the effecto to a grey gradient... Should be fixed in the next update.

I'll try to do a bit more poking around on my end as well. This wasn't exactly on a clean install although I mostly use part packs (the only visual enhancement mods I use were already on your list ). When I get home tomorrow I'll grab a clean install and verify that I'm still seeing it there.
Nice work, I only have one wish: could you export your skybox in 2x this resolution and in PNGs? (If not for the package, just for me )
Very nice work

Nice work, I only have one wish: could you export your skybox in 2x this resolution and in PNGs? (If not for the package, just for me )

Yes, but believe me:

a) compression is disabled for the skybox and the JPG is at the 99% of the original quality.

If you don't have a monitor with higher resolutions than 1920x1080 you shouldn't be capable to see the difference between 2K and 4K for that distances and scales.

Yeah Proot sorry for the undescriptive help, I am having the same problem as Tygoo7, I do have a clean install (I reinstalled KSP before installing your mod's dependencies and then this, I did erase the TGAs)

The smoke and exhaust effects look fine for all the other engines I have tested so far, it's just the SRBs.

Looks like a problem with the .mu files, its configs or the smoke screen plugin. But I can't reproduce that.

Should look like this:

The reason for the white smoke is try to reproduce the superheated smoke of a real SRB, where is truly hard to distinguish where ends the flame and starts the smoke.

So, someone more is having the same problem?

Yes, but believe me:

If you don't have a monitor with higher resolutions than 1920x1080 you shouldn't be capable to see the difference between 2K and 4K for that distances and scales.

Yes, I totally agree, but with http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/34631-0-23-Bolt-On-Screenshot-System-%28BOSS%29-v2-1-4 you can make higher resolution screenshots If it is much work, then don't bother, but if it is not much of a hassle for you, then please (please please) PM me with a link to the higher res version

Yes, I totally agree, but with http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/34631-0-23-Bolt-On-Screenshot-System-%28BOSS%29-v2-1-4 you can make higher resolution screenshots If it is much work, then don't bother, but if it is not much of a hassle for you, then please (please please) PM me with a link to the higher res version

I'll send you asap.

The game seems to lock up wail it is loading. Once it reaches TextureReplacer/Plugins/TextureReplacer it just stops.

This pack might be TOO MUCH for KSP to handle...
People who are new with ActiveTextureManagement, it freezes for a minute or so at loading. That's perfectly normal.

Proot: Yes. Here's a stripped-down RSS with a demo cfg.

https://www.dropbox.com/s/y9hs9f3mukdmzn1/RSSCLEANv6.1pre.zip

Dios mio...

Amazing work, Proot!

HOT DAMN IT'S A MIRACLE!

Should I be getting massive slowdowns at launch? I'm talking less than 10fps while everything else runs smooth. Something to do with all those smokescreen particles?

http://imgur.com/a/RQXnS So the glowing Mun effect has one major problem: It has an atmosphere. This really does kind of ruin the mod for me.

EDIT: and yes, I am using the very latest version of E.V.E.

Edited April 18, 2014 by GregroxMun

This pack is amazing Proot ! I'm definitely settling for it. However, I do experience massive slowdowns at launch like TheCrimsonCorndog above : I've only tested it with a single rocket so far, but it was a simple one (4 engines, 6 SRBs, less than 60 parts in total if I remember correctly). Is it the SRB smoke causing the lag ?

Wasn't there supposed to be a better texture for the Mk 1-2 pod? It looks like the mod has actually downgraded the texture:

Also Kerbin has a blue tint in map view but it looks like this in flight

Edit: Wait a minute, every texture is messed up

Did you copy all the KSPRC fold over ? 2 pic that's a change some like it some don't and 3 pic there where new texture for some of the part's in pic and blackheart612 makes some great retexture's of stock parts, I think should have been added to this mod you can find here http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/68787-WIP-Squad-Re-texture-Project-%28KW-Style-Maybe%29

EDIT I should have said everything in the KSPRC folder like open it up you see GameData open it you see 11 folders copy all them to KSP/GameData and over ride all.

Edit: Wait a minute, every texture is messed up

http://i.imgur.com/X7skoyb.png

You have not followed the installation process correctly. Is quite obvious. Seems like Texture Replacer is not correctly installed.

The "blue tint" is in fact an attempt to reproduce the distance effect caused by the atmosphere in the reality, and (as the real one) increases as you are more and more far from Kerbin.

About the hexes: is a problem from EVE caused by the cloud shadows. But I'm working to avoid it.

Edited April 18, 2014 by Proot

Proot! Felicidades! You have a superb mod for KSP! Everything works as intended. I am using a plain vanilla KSP v0.23.5 with the required mods and your pack! It only uses about 2.5 GB of RAM and loads up fairly quick compared to my previous versions of KSP w/other mods. I will now add some of my favorite mods (Hull Camera, Protractor, ProcFairings, KW, Kosmos and SovietPack). Only thing I have noticed is the FPS hit with the lift off smoke effects which is beautiful! Te adrezco por compatir esta obra de arte!
